009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.BradfordAdaptation;
013import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.ChromaticAdaptation;
014import imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant;
015
016import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
017
018import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D50;
019import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D65;
020
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * This class implements the CIELab color space. See Sec. 14.2 of [1] for details. All component values are assumed to
025 * be in [0,1]. Conversion from/to sRGB is implemented directly on D65-based XYZ coordinates, i.e., without
026 * conversion to Java's D50-based profile connection space. The methods fromCIEXYZ/toCIEXYZ still return D50-based XYZ
027 * coordinates in Java's profile connection space. This is a singleton class with no public constructors, use
028 * {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
029 * </p>
030 * <p>
031 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
032 * (2022).
033 * </p>
034 *
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2022/09/01
037 */
038@SuppressWarnings("serial")
039public class LabColorSpace extends ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion {
040        private static final sRGB65ColorSpace srgbCS = sRGB65ColorSpace.getInstance();
041        private static final LabColorSpace instance = new LabColorSpace();
042        
043        public static LabColorSpace getInstance() {
044                return instance;
045        }
046
047        // D65 reference white point:
048        private static final double[] XYZref = StandardIlluminant.D65.getXYZ();
049
050        // chromatic adaptation objects:
051        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D65, D50);
052        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50, D65);
053
054        /**
055         * Constructor.
056         */
057        private LabColorSpace() {
058                super(TYPE_Lab, 3);
059        }
060
061        // XYZ50 -> CIELab: returns Lab values from XYZ (relative to D50)
062
063        /**
064         * Converts color points in D50-based XYZ space to CIELab coordinates. This
065         * method implements {@link ColorSpace#fromCIEXYZ(float[])}), assuming that
066         * the specified color coordinate is in D50-based XYZ space (with components
067         * in [0,1]). See also {@link #fromCIEXYZ65(float[])} for a D65-based
068         * version.
069         *
070         * @param XYZ50 a color in D50-based XYZ space (components in [0,1])
071         * @return the associated CIELab color
072         */
073        @Override
074        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {      
075                float[] XYZ65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);
076                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
077        }
078
079        // XYZ65 -> CIELab: returns Lab values from XYZ (relative to D65)
080        @Override
081        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {
082                double xx = f1(XYZ65[0] / XYZref[0]);   
083                double yy = f1(XYZ65[1] / XYZref[1]);
084                double zz = f1(XYZ65[2] / XYZref[2]);
085                double L = 116.0 * yy - 16.0;
086                double a = 500.0 * (xx - yy);
087                double b = 200.0 * (yy - zz);
088                return new float[] {(float)L, (float)a, (float)b};
089        }
090
091        // CIELab -> XYZ50: returns XYZ values (relative to D50) from Lab
092        @Override // returns D50-based XYZ from Lab values
093        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] Lab) {
094                float[] XYZ65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(Lab);
095                return catD65toD50.applyTo(XYZ65);
096        }
097
098        // CIELab -> XYZ65: returns XYZ values (relative to D65) from Lab
099        @Override
100        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] Lab) {
101                double ll = (Lab[0] + 16.0) / 116.0;
102                double Y65 = XYZref[1] * f2(ll);
103                double X65 = XYZref[0] * f2(ll + Lab[1] / 500.0);
104                double Z65 = XYZref[2] * f2(ll - Lab[2] / 200.0);
105                return new float[] {(float)X65, (float)Y65, (float)Z65};
106        }
107
108        //sRGB -> CIELab (direct, without adaptation to D50)
109        @Override
110        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
111                float[] xyz65 = srgbCS.toCIEXYZ65(srgb);
112                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(xyz65);
113        }
114
115        //CIELab -> sRGB (direct, without adaptation to D50)
116        @Override
117        public float[] toRGB(float[] Lab) {
118                float[] XYZ65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(Lab);
119                return srgbCS.fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
120        }
121
122        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
123
124        private static final double Epsilon = 216.0/24389;
125        private static final double Kappa = 841.0/108;
126
127        // Gamma correction for L* (forward)
128        private static double f1 (double c) {
129                return (c > Epsilon) ? Math.cbrt(c) : (Kappa * c) + (16.0 / 116);
130        }
131
132        // Gamma correction for L* (inverse)
133        private static double f2 (double c) {
134                double c3 = c * c * c; //Math.pow(c, 3.0);
135                return (c3 > Epsilon) ? c3 : (c - 16.0 / 116) / Kappa;
136        }
137
138}
